Description: Adolescent and young adult (AYA) patients are defined by the National Cancer Institute as those diagnosed with cancer between 15 to 39 years old. While this age range is intended to be inclusive in its breadth, it also encompasses diverse disease biology, psychosocial and developmental milestones, and iatrogenic risks that require a more nuanced approach to care delivery across that chronological spectrum. This sessions aims to describe the past and present AYA oncology landscape, highlight unique challenges in treating AYAs vs. patients 40 and older, and clarify hereditary predispositions to early-onset malignancy.
SearchResultBody: FO01. What Are the Challenges and Solutions in Adolescent and Young Adult Cancers?
Title: What Are the Challenges and Solutions in Adolescent and Young Adult Cancers?
